data.title: Sing Louder by meghancary.com
data.text:
Lyrics

I feel feet tapping through the floor

I hear hammers on strings

Rising under the door

She is whiling the hours away

She plays her music

Most every day

She’s seen life that I’ve never known

Over 100 years old

And she is still on the go

When I ask how she’s lived all those years

She laughs till she cries

Then she speaks through her tears

She says…

Live what you love

Love what you do

Laugh with your friends

Cry with them too

Sing every day

Sing out loud sing out clear

If you don’t know the words

Sing louder

Sing stronger

Sing louder, sing stronger

For all the world to hear

She’s walking out when I’m walking in

On her arm is a cane

On her face is a grin

When I ask how she’s feeling today

Her smile tells it all

But here’s what she says:

Live what you love

Love what you do

Laugh with your friends

Cry with them too

Sing every day

Sing out loud sing out clear

If you don’t know the words

Sing louder

Sing stronger

Sing louder, sing stronger

For all the world to hear

When she left us

The silence was deafening

So I climbed up the stairs

To her room

I sat at her keys

With my hands on my knees

Till a song filled my heart

It was loud it was clear

I wasn’t quite sure

Of all of the words

So I sang louder

I sang stronger

I sang louder and stronger

For all the world to hear

I sang…

Live what you love

Love what you do

Laugh with your friends

Cry with them too

Sing every day

Sing out loud sing out clear

If you don’t know the words

Sing louder

Sing stronger

Sing louder, sing stronger

For all the world to hear
